column5: Saturday I struck out on my favourite Kawartha spots...Plenty of Sunfish, but no Crappie. Monday I went to Stoney Lake and struck-out again. Wednesday I went back to re-check my regular spots... My best places were still barren, but I found about 10 Crappie around the boat launch. This afternoon, at 3:30 when the neighbour's 9 year old got off the School Bus, Daddy and I were waiting for her with the boat and tackle. We only had two hours, before supper time, but we managed to get another 15 from the same spot.   The water was 62F degrees or 16C in that little pocket and there was some new weed growth. My guess is that the other spots will start to pay off in a couple more days.
Nice report and pics. Time to load the canoe and head up!
What a crappie report.What the hell ya got attached to yer ears there spock?
Good stuff Garry, i'm as green as that new weed growth with envy...lol...far too much ice up here still!
Great report and pics Garry  Some fine slabs you guys caught!!! congratulations Thanks for sharing Leechman
Yep, starting to make their way in.  Another week or so of half-decent warm weather and they will be really on!

Brian: Those are ear-buds for guys who don't like anything in their ears...I was getting down with some tunes, man! I have the worlds largest collection of 50's Rock and Do-op by people who are dead...HAHAHA
